channel.title: Captitalizing Names
channel.description:
In codes such as:
c2.sendMessage("@cya@[OWNER] " +playerName+ " has just logged in.");
When ran in the server, the players name appears as a lower case such as (bob), Instead of (Bob). Im siply wondering what to add in this code in order to make the players name start with a capital letter :)
Thanks, Basak

item.title: Captitalizing Names
item.dc:creator: @ITI_Basak_ITI ITI Basak ITI
item.description:
@ITI_Basak_ITI wrote:

Started this whole learning process couple days ago. Skills are increasing but I do not know how to go about doing that. I guess Ill just wait to fix that until I get better at all this. Main reason I ask this is because of Clan Chat. Im a picky person and I dont like seeing the Talking in: basak… I want it to be Basak! lol but oh well…

Read full topic

item.title: Captitalizing Names
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

ITI Basak ITI:

hmmm, There has to be an easier way Surprised there isn’t something like how the colors work (@red@)m that you could add right in front of playerName

You could probably add something to do that.

item.title: Captitalizing Names
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

ITI Basak ITI:

what does the string to title case code look like?

I’m not sure, but it should be in a class called something like “StringUtils”. Some code that would work is something like

String s = "s is dErp";
s = s.toLowerCase();
byte[] raw = s.getBytes();
raw[0] -= 0x20;
for (int i = 0; i < raw.length; i++) {
	if (raw[i] == 0x20) {
		raw[i + 1] -= 0x20;
	}
}
return new String(raw);

But it’s not very pretty. There’s more than likely a better way to do it.

Read full topic

item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“ITI Basak ITI, post:1, topic:394331”]In codes such as:

c2.sendMessage("@cya@[OWNER] " +playerName+ " has just logged in.");

When ran in the server, the players name appears as a lower case such as (bob), Instead of (Bob). Im siply wondering what to add in this code in order to make the players name start with a capital letter

Thanks, Basak[/quote]

You could probably copy the code from the client to convert a string to title case.
